title: Clora Bryant, jazz ‘trumpetiste’, one of few women of her time to play professionally, who accompanied Billie Holiday and Josephine Baker – obituary
text:
Clora Bryant, who has died aged 92, was a jazz trumpeter or, as she preferred, “trumpetiste”. For many years she was one of the few women anywhere to play the instrument professionally.

The trumpet had long been regarded as a uniquely male instrument, calling for physical strength, stamina and a measure of bravado in those who played it.

None of this was true but, in her young days, Clora Bryant found that male players tended to live up to the image, defending it “like a bulldog on a bone”. She succeeded in at least denting that stereotype.
